UIElement.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

data.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

OTHER.description: Any motion-profile which is not defined by the AxisMotionProfileEnumeration.

ROTARY.description: Rotary motion is a rotation along a circular path with defined limits. Motion movement is not going always in the same direction. Control unit is mainly degree.

ROTARY_ENDLESS.description: Rotary motion is a rotation along a circular path with no limits. Motion movement is going endless in the same direction. Control unit is mainly degree.

LINEAR.description: Linear motion is a one dimensional motion along a straight line with defined limits. Motion movement is not going always in the same direction. Control unit is mainly mm.

LINEAR_ENDLESS.description: Linear motion is a one dimensional motion along a straight line with no limits. Motion movement is going endless in the same direction. Control unit is mainly mm.

MotionProfile.title: AxisMotionProfileEnumeration
MotionProfile.description: The kind of axis motion as defined with the AxisMotionProfileEnumeration.

GearRatio.title: RationalNumber
GearRatio.description: The transmission ratio of the gear expressed as a fraction as input velocity (motor side) by output velocity (load side).

Pitch.description: Pitch describes the distance covered in millimeters (mm) for linear motion per one revolution of the output side of the driving unit. Pitch is used in combination with GearRatio to describe the overall transmission from input to output of the gear.

data.title: RationalNumber
data.description: The transmission ratio of the gear expressed as a fraction as input velocity (motor side) by output velocity (load side).

Pitch describes the distance covered in millimeters (mm) for linear motion per one revolution of the output side of the driving unit. Pitch is used in combination with GearRatio to describe the overall transmission from input to output of the gear.

CenterOfMass.title: ThreeDFrame
CenterOfMass.description: The position and orientation of the center of the mass related to the mounting point using a FrameType. X, Y, Z define the position of the center of gravity relative to the mounting point coordinate system. A, B, C define the orientation of the principal axes of inertia relative to the mounting point coordinate system. Orientation A, B, C can be '0' for systems which do not need these  values.

Inertia.title: ThreeDVector
Inertia.description: The Inertia uses the VectorType to describe the three values of the principal moments of inertia with respect to the mounting point coordinate system. If inertia values are provided for rotary axis the CenterOfMass shall be completely filled as well.

Mass.description: The weight of the load mounted on one mounting point.

data.title: ThreeDFrame
data.description: The position and orientation of the center of the mass related to the mounting point using a FrameType. X, Y, Z define the position of the center of gravity relative to the mounting point coordinate system. A, B, C define the orientation of the principal axes of inertia relative to the mounting point coordinate system. Orientation A, B, C can be '0' for systems which do not need these  values.

data.title: ThreeDVector
data.description: The Inertia uses the VectorType to describe the three values of the principal moments of inertia with respect to the mounting point coordinate system. If inertia values are provided for rotary axis the CenterOfMass shall be completely filled as well.
The weight of the load mounted on one mounting point.

OTHER.description: Any MotionDevice which is not defined by the MotionDeviceCategoryEnumeration.

ARTICULATED_ROBOT.description: This robot design features rotary joints and can range from simple two joint structures to 10 or more joints. The arm is connected to the base with a twisting joint. The links in the arm are connected by rotary joints.

SCARA_ROBOT.description: The robot has two parallel rotary joints that ensure compliance in a specified plane.

CARTESIAN_ROBOT.description: Cartesian robots have three linear joints that use the Cartesian coordinate system (X, Y, and Z). They also may have an attached wrist to allow for rotational movement. The three prismatic joints provide linear movement along the axis.

SPHERICAL_ROBOT.description: The arm is connected to the base with a twisting joint and a combination of two rotary joints and one linear joint. The axes form a polar coordinate system and create a spherical shaped work envelope.

PARALLEL_ROBOT.description: These spider like robots are built from jointed parallelograms connected to a common base. The parallelograms move a single EOAT in a dome-shaped work area.

CYLINDRICAL_ROBOT.description: The robot has at least one rotary joint at the base and at least one prismatic joint to connect the links. The rotary joint uses a rotational motion along the joint axis, while the prismatic joint moves in a linear motion. Cylindrical robots operate within a cylindrical-shaped work envelope.

MotionDeviceCategory.title: MotionDeviceCategoryEnumeration
MotionDeviceCategory.description: The variable MotionDeviceCategory provides the kind of motion device defined by MotionDeviceCategoryEnumeration based on ISO 8373.
